_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: All Other Miscellaneous Chemical Product and Preparation Manufacturing

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
This facility receives Carbon Dioxide as a byproduct of ethanol production from The Anderson's LLC ethanol plant located in Denison IA.  The Carbon Dioxide is purified, compressed and refrigerated into liquid form and the liquid Carbon dioxide is stored under pressure as a refrigerated liquid.  The

facility also manufactures and processes various forms of solid Carbon Dioxide (dry ice). Ammonia is used as the refrigerant in an Ammonia refrigeration system located on the facility. An ammonia receiver stores the Ammonia refrigerant  in addition to various heat exchangers, compressors, condensers and connecting piping and valves.



Our worst case scenario for ammonia system is a failure of the ammonia receiver resulting in the release of ammonia. The quantity of the release is estimated to be 8,000lb of ammonia over a 10 minute period of time with most stable of atmospheric conditions which minimizes dispersion of a release and thus the worst case of quantity released and worst case due to atmospheric conditions. The calculated toxic endpoint of which the concentration is calculated not to exceed 200ppm is 1.5 miles.  These calculations were based on the EPA's "Risk Management Program Guidance for Ammonia Refrigeration."  Public receptors identified within 1.5 miles of the facility include commercial/industrial areas.



An alternate release scenario was also calculated using EPA guidelines. A leak from a pipe, pump or vessel was assumed to create a release rate of 200lb per minute.  The atmospheric condition are assumed to be more typical of the area and the toxic endpoint of which the ammonia concentration is calculated not to exceed 200ppm is 0.3 miles.  Again, calculations were based on the

EPA's "Risk Management Guidelines fro Ammonia Refrigeration." Public receptors within 0.1 miles of the facility include commercial/industrial facilities.



This facility complies with the EPA's accidental release prevention program and all applicable state and local codes an

d regulations.  In addition, this facility complies with the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) Process Safety Management Program. Our comprehensive prevention program includes documented  process safety information to ensure safe and reliable plant operation, process hazard analysis to identify and train all effected employees in the hazards associated with the operation of an ammonia refrigeration system, mechanical integrity procedures to ensure adequate and proper plant maintenance.  Should an accident or near miss occur, procedures are in place to thoroughly investigate the incident and take corrective action as necessary. We believe the key to preventing incidents is continuously improving our operating and prevention procedures and better educating our employees.



This is a new facility with all refrigeration components being made within ASME and ASHRAE

specifications. The system is also to be thoroughly inspected and tested prior to starting the system.



In the event of an Ammonia release, the plant has developed an emergency response plan and procedure.  If necessary, the Denison Fire Department  will be contacted and emergency response procedures  will be coordinated with the Denison Fire Department and the county. LEPC and any other local authorities in order to most effectively  protect our employees, our property and our community.
